answers.answer: Your symptoms do not spell out any specific disease entity, but you should ask your doctor about generalized anxiety, and possibly test your blood sugar, though diabetes is unlikely.
You could just have an anxiety disorder like GAD, Social Phobia, OCD etc.
Have you had your B=12 level checked? If not you need to, many symptoms you have posted are related & B-12 definiency is very common with malabsorption.

question: Since I was in my 20's, 20 years ago, I have had most of the symptoms of hyperthyroidism. Recently, I was tested for it, and I tested negative. What other medical problems could I test for? My symptoms are: high anxiety, poor memory, optimism, and malabsorption of food. I believe I have malabsorption because I must eat much food, especially protein, to reduce the symptoms, and because my concentration becomes very poor by 5:00 or 6:00 PM.
title: Symptoms of Hyperthyroidism
